name: Lienzo VR
description:
Turn your HTC Vive into a drawing tablet with Lienzo VR. Somewhere between a fun app and a useful tool lies Lienzo; experiment with big strokes, make delicate details, or paint some rad graffiti. Change how the brushes interact with the distance and trigger pressure for an optimal experience, and enjoy a full palette in your thumbs. Paint with two hands or one, and customize all the important details while the rest sits on a non-invasive UI.

  • Trigger to paint or select brush/option
  • Touchpad to select Hue or Saturation/Value. Don't worry, you can't change Hue while changing Sat/Val and viceversa :)
  • Grip buttons to select color while looking at canvas
  • Grip buttons to move, rotate and resize canvas when outlined
  • Sliders are manipulated using the touchpads. Press the 'Dist' or 'Trigger' to use that as the value (for example, a brush that paints bigger when you're far away)

Here's a short video tutorial

Please, send your artworks and feedback to daniel.hurtadoramirez314@gmail.com

Update 1.1: Added exit button, added cursor, improved file system to be relative.

Now you can get the source code. Warning: it is an Unreal Engine 4.13 project that wasn't originally coded for people to see, understand, and reuse, so download at your own risk.
